alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Jasper; Lauderdale; Newton (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 03 at 4:59AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Jasper, southeastern Newton, northern Clarke and Lauderdale Counties through 600 AM CDT... At 459 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Newton, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Meehan around 510 AM CDT. Suqualena and Savoy around 515 AM CDT. Meridian and Nellieburg around 520 AM CDT. Zero around 525 AM CDT. Marion around 530 AM CDT. Toomsuba and Alamucha around 535 AM CDT. Lauderdale and Kewanee around 540 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Chunky and Hickory. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for east central Mississippi.
